news_header: Valmet announces layoffs and fixed-term task decisions affecting 112 employees.
news_text: Valmet has decided to lay off 112 employees and will also determine fixed-term tasks within the company. In September, the company initiated change negotiations at its Kartonki and paper mills business unit in Papert, which may lead to up to 90-day layoffs in the first half of 2025. Initially, 200 positions were considered for reduction. Employment trends are reportedly improving in Jyväskylä, Järvenpää, Raisio, and Tampere. Mikko Sillanpää, the director of the business unit, stated that the specific impacts on personnel are not yet identified. Valmet employs approximately 6,600 people in Finland and over 19,000 globally.
